result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A. Brockman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher A. Brockman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher A. Brockman was found guilty of Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent. Not to operate m/v w/o valid DL.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Homicide by Use of Vehicle with PAC

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher A. Brockman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher A. Brockman in court with attorney Kara Rolf.  Defendant Christopher A. Brockman in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  A couple of people appear by phone just to listen to the arguments and sentencing.  Court states case and appearances by phone, attorneys state other appearances.  Parties rec/rev PSI and are ready to proceed.  State notes two people will make statements prior to sentencing.  C.L. makes statement.  D.P. makes statement.  State makes recommendations.  Atty Rolf makes her recommendations.  Recess for 5 minutes.  Back on the record.  State makes clarifications re: other recommendations.  Atty Rolf responds/they don't object to requests by state.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE re: appeal rights, voting right and felony firearms warnings.

Ct 1:
11 years prison (5 years initial confinement + 6 years extended supervision) to commence forthwith
DL revocation for 5 years
IID for 5 years effective upon licensure
AODA
Conditions of extended supervision:
$438.25 in restitution to S.C. plus all applicable surcharges
$518.00 costs/surcharges and $450.00 DIS
DNA sample to be provided
Absolute sobriety at all times 
Not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business where primary purpose of business is the sale of alcohol
Not to drive w/o valid DL
Must comply w/any treatment recommendations per agent
351 days credit to be applied including today's date
DE is NOT eligible for CIP/ERP/SAP
Cover Letter from Atty. Raabe w/CD attached
Sentencing hearing on January 11, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher A. Brockman in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Christopher A. Brockman in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Raabe states DE will be entering a plea today.  Plea questionaire provided.  State says DE will plea to Ct 1 and the parties will request a PSI w/argued sentencing.  Atty Raabe is in agreement and NC plea entered to Ct 1.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Court orders PSI to be completed no later than 12/22/2016.  Bond continued pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial on November 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on October 17, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher A. Brockman in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Defendant Christopher A. Brockman in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.

Defendant Christopher A. Brockman in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Defendant Christopher A. Brockman in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.

Pre-trial conference at 02-19-2016 09:45 am.
Return date at 03-03-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher A. Brockman in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant recv'd and waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests $10,000 cash bond.  Atty. ORourke requests high PA bond and makes argument.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $5000.00 Cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute Sobriety; not go into any taverns or liquor stores; not operate m/v; take chemical test if requested; not leave State of WI; reside with mother  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
